linearState.title: Automate PR creation/linking when Linear tickets are updated
linearState.description:
Define and implement automation to create or link a GitHub PR when a Linear issue is updated (clarify exact behavior), ensuring no duplication with existing PR→Linear flows.

* Clarify desired behavior: create a new PR vs. link to an existing PR on certain Linear updates (which updates?)
* Coordinate with existing work (EXMR-672) that links PRs to Linear and updates status on PR events
* Design webhook/worker flow, idempotency keys, and safeguards to avoid spam/duplicates
* Implement feature flag/config per team
* Add logging/metrics and basic tests

linearState.title: Finish VibeWork harness and refine Camille’s PR to improve ambient ticket quality
linearState.description:
Complete the VibeWork harness and use it to refine Camille’s ticket creation logic PR for higher-quality ambient ticketing.

* Finish harness that ingests Slack-only threads, supports retries/self-correction, and measures success/turn count
* Use insights from harness runs to rewrite or adjust Camille’s PR to improve ticket creation quality and logic
* Ensure harness outputs are suitable for future evals focused on MVN extraction quality
* Add basic tests/docs for running the harness locally and in CI

linearState.title: Investigate GitHub extraction creating unknown/extra Linear tickets; add event-level visibility
linearState.description:
Investigate why GitHub extraction is generating unknown/extra Linear tickets and implement diagnostics to make every action visible.

* Reproduce and diagnose cases where GitHub extraction creates unexpected/new tickets
* Audit flow for missing/implicit 'skip' logic when no existing issue is found to update
* Add structured logging/metrics for each GitHub extraction action (CREATE/UPDATE/SKIP/NOOP) with identifiers for traceability
* Compare implementation against the Exponent repo and align behavior to avoid extraneous tickets
* Output visibility should mirror Slack extraction’s current transparency (per meeting)
* Coordinate with David starting tomorrow on extraction quality

linearState.title: Fix duplicate Slack notifications after meeting transcript processing
linearState.description:
Eliminate duplicate Slack notifications when meeting transcripts are processed, likely due to multiple document update events.

* Reproduce duplicate notification case cited by Johnny
* Implement idempotency/debouncing keyed by artifact ID + event type to ensure a single notification per processed meeting
* Filter/aggregate multiple doc-update events to one outbound Slack message
* Compare and align with Exponent repo’s approach if it already solved this
* Add unit/integration tests around the meetingProcessor and SlackMessageSender paths

linearState.title: Emit Slack notifications for PR-driven Linear task creation and updates
linearState.description:
Post Slack messages to the relevant team channel when Linear issues are created from PRs or when existing Linear issues are updated due to PR events.

* Scope: PR-driven CREATE and UPDATE operations on Linear issues
* Channel: use existing linear_team_id → Slack channel mapping (same approach as meeting extraction notifications)
* Message content: include PR link/number, Linear issue identifier/title, and action (created/updated) with a brief summary of changes
* Avoid duplication with existing meeting/GitHub extraction notifications (post once per event)
* Confirm exact channel targeting with team owners if needed (undecided)

linearState.title: Reduce standard notification size
linearState.description:
Reduce standard Slack notification size by removing the summary line in ambient-extraction.

linearState.title: Host web bundles on S3 + Cloudfront
linearState.description:
Host web bundles on S3 + CloudFront to eliminate deploy-time whitescreens caused by 404s on old JS bundles. Serve versioned assets via CDN and rewrite index.html to point to CDN-hosted bundles.

PR #2176: Currently in review
Link: [https://github.com/gathertown/corporate-context/pull/2176](https://github.com/gathertown/corporate-context/pull/2176)

Key changes in PR #2176:

* CI/CD:
  * Add upload-s3-assets input and id-token: write permissions where needed.
  * New build-assets job builds frontend/backend, uploads assets to s3://assets.getgrapevine.ai/app/<short-sha>/assets, and publishes a built-assets artifact.
  * Build matrix (grapevine) consumes prebuilt assets; passes ASSETS_COMMIT_SHA and USE_PREBUILT_ASSETS.
* Docker (Dockerfile.grapevine):
  * Add ASSETS_COMMIT_SHA and USE_PREBUILT_ASSETS build args; copy prebuilt-assets/ into image when present.
  * Conditionally use prebuilt frontend assets or build in-image; always build backend; place assets in admin-backend/dist/public/.
* Backend (admin-backend server.ts):
  * Rewrite index.html href/src="/assets/..." to ${ASSETS_BASE_URL||[https://assets.getgrapevine.ai](https://assets.getgrapevine.ai)}/app/${ASSETS_COMMIT_SHA}/assets/... when ASSETS_COMMIT_SHA is set; cache rewritten HTML.
  * Explicitly serve /index.html; express.static with { index: false }; return 404 for missing /assets/\*.

linearState.title: Fix MCP in headless mode
linearState.description:
Fix MCP in headless mode.

PR #2261: Merged on 2025-12-03 — [https://github.com/gathertown/corporate-context/pull/2261](https://github.com/gathertown/corporate-context/pull/2261)
Author: btraut

Key changes:

* Use an explicit MCP config file at /tmp/mcp-config.json and pass it via --mcp-config to Claude Code
* Verify presence and required contents of /tmp/mcp-config.json (package name and env vars)
* Pass --mcp-config in both su and direct runs of claude; echo the MCP config path in logs
* Copy the MCP config for non-root 'testrunner' and set MCP_CONFIG_FILE for both root and non-root environments
* Preserve existing prompt handling and permissions

Impact: Ensures reliable MCP operation in headless/CI by avoiding reliance on home-directory config files.

linearState.title: Post meeting + GitHub extraction notifications to AMBIENT_FEEDBACK_CHANNEL_ID; keep meeting extraction posting to team Linear
linearState.description:
PR #2275: Merged on 2025-12-04 — [https://github.com/gathertown/corporate-context/pull/2275](https://github.com/gathertown/corporate-context/pull/2275)

Key changes delivered by PR #2275:

* Introduced SlackMessageSender utility (utils/sendSlackMessage.ts): fetches Slack bot token from SSM, resolves channel by linear_team_id via tenant DB, and posts via Slack chat.postMessage with text and rich blocks; supports optional threads; structured logging via LogContext.
* Integrated Slack notifications into processors/meetingProcessor.ts: after executing Linear operations, if any succeeded (>0), send a formatted meeting summary to the mapped team channel.
* Notification content includes meeting title/date, totals (total/success/failed), and per‑operation details with links, identifiers, and titles; maps REQUEST_CLARIFICATION to SKIP for display.
* Simplified error logging in meetingProcessor by JSON‑stringifying errors.

linearState.title: Restore Slack user → Linear user mapping to fix assignee assignment
linearState.description:
Restore Slack user → Linear user mapping to fix assignee assignment.

PR #2249: Merged on 2025-12-03
Link: [https://github.com/gathertown/corporate-context/pull/2249](https://github.com/gathertown/corporate-context/pull/2249)
Author: karenying

Key changes:

* Utils (src/utils/userMapping.ts): Implement mapSlackToLinearId using linearSlackUserMapping with flexible identifier matching; add reverse lookup mapLinearToSlackId returning UserMapping; introduce and export UserMapping type.
* Data/Primitives (src/primitives/linear-slack-user-mapping.ts): Add populated linearSlackUserMapping array of Linear↔Slack user records.
* Scripts (scripts/fetch-linear-slack-user-mapping.ts): New script to fetch users from Linear/Slack, produce mapping, and write JSON/CSV/TS outputs.
* Public API (src/index.ts): Export mapLinearToSlackId and UserMapping alongside mapSlackToLinearId.

Impact: Restores Slack→Linear assignee mapping, improving assignee accuracy during ticket creation and updates.
